name: branch-maker
description: Create a new branch and allows you to apply a Branch Policy
author: Kerwin Carpede

inputs.name: repository
inputs.label: Repository
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the name of the repository to create the branch in

inputs.name: sourceBranchName
inputs.label: Source Branch
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the branch to base the new branch off. A valid branch name must be provided.

inputs.name: newBranchName
inputs.label: New Branch
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the name of the new branch. Example release/M1

inputs.name: applyBranchPolicy
inputs.label: Apply Branch Policy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Apply a branch policy to the new branch e.g Require a minimum of approvers etc. Enable this to see all available options.

inputs.name: requireMinimumReviewers
inputs.label: Require a minimum number of reviewers
inputs.helpMarkDown: Require approval from a specified number of reviewers on pull requests.

inputs.name: MinimumApproverCount
inputs.label: Minimum number of reviewers
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifiy how many approvers are required.

inputs.name: creatorVoteCounts
inputs.label: Allow users to approve their own changes

inputs.name: allowDownvotes
inputs.label: Allow completion even if some reviewers vote Waiting or Reject

inputs.name: resetOnSourcePush
inputs.label: Reset code reviewer votes when there are new changes.

inputs.name: checkForLinkedWorkItems
inputs.label: Check for linked work items
inputs.helpMarkDown: Encourage traceability by checking for linked work items on pull requests.

inputs.name: checkForCommentResolution
inputs.label: Check for comment resolution
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check to see that all comments have been resolved on pull requests.

inputs.name: enforceMergeStrategy
inputs.label: Enforce a merge strategy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check to see that all comments have been resolved on pull requests.

inputs.name: authenticationType
inputs.label: Authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the authentication type to use for communicating with the TFS API. Note: For OAuth Token, 'Allow scripts to access OAuth token' must be enabled in the build definition options. If 'Windows Authentication' is selected, this would be the account being used by the Build Agent.
